page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO SURVEY
page.content: The survey covers a rural area. Despite being a predominantly mining area in the past, villagers occupations are now wide ranging. The area is overshadowed by a high rate of unemployment. Typical of this is Escomb, the unemployment blackspot of our Survey. With the closure of collieries and ironworks, people have been forced to leave the area and almost whole communities have disappeared. Despite this and the problem that most people have to travel to work outside the immediate area some of the community spirit seems to have been retained and local Community Centres are highly valued by the residents. The area is steeped in history; for example the "Rail Trail" follows part of the first public passenger railway in the world - the Stockton to Darlington line (1825)
